Detailed Description

Most important manager, it is constructed on every page load.

Handles user log in and out, starts session and creates the BlackBox and the Shopping cart. All other managers must inherit from Manager because this functionality is essential. Managers also have virtual functions printLeftMenu and printRightMenu that are called in leftMenu.php resp. rightMenu.php and can be different for every page.

There is one more thing Manager has to do, take care of behavior cookies that come to the server side. It only happens with certain browsers and their weird onUnload event handling. This is described on the main page.

Definition at line 27 of file manager.php.

Definition at line 38 of file manager.php.

Member Function Documentation

dealWithBehaviorCookies (  ) 

Handle cookies with behavior on the server side.

This is called only when user's browser is Chrome or Safari (WebKit). It call's appropriate blackBox's function and deletes the behavior cookies. This is used only when sending info on unload event was used. If not, client side will take care of the cookies. This is because setting the preference may take significant time so that page loading would be delayed.

Definition at line 123 of file manager.php.
